You crossed a line and now I will never even like you.” She then spent about a minute experimenting with the durability of Gideon’s face vs. the floor and walls. “If you ever come near me or my family again, I will end you!” Teeth bared, she crushed the amulet in her bare hand, ending its power forever and dropping Gideon. “Now get out.”
“Okay fine. Ah’ll leave,” Gideon conceded, backing away with a limp and clothes in tatters. “But Ah promise. This isn’t the last you’ve seen of Wittle. Ol’. M-”
“Get out!”
“Agh! Ah’m gettin’!”
Dipper waited until things quieted down. “W-wow Mabel. I-I’ve never seen that side of you be-”
“Wha-ha-ha!” Mabel cried as she flung herself onto Dipper, tears gushing from her eyes and onto his clothes. “You idiot! You stupid, stupid idiot! You knew it was a trap, but you still went anyway. That shit almost cut you with scissors. You can’t handle scissors!”
Dipper opened his mouth, but didn’t know what to say. He could point out that there were factors that couldn’t have been accounted for, that he’s withstood worse and maybe could have handled the scissors, or that Mabel had agreed to this whole plan, but he couldn’t see any of those arguments ending well for him. And with the tears of his beloved sister ripping his heart out, he finally settled on something to say. “You protected me.”
Mabel took a break from her constricting embrace and pulled back enough to look Dipper in the eye. She was ugly crying and hated that he was seeing her like this. However, there was something about his smile that lifted her spirits just a tad.
“I knew I’d be fine, because you protected me like you always do.”
Mabel fell right back to bawling, but with most of the fear and anger removed. Now there was only relief mixed with a bit of joy that everything was alright. No more words were exchanged as the pair sat there in the warehouse, holding one another for comfort.
When Gideon finally made it back home, the first thing he did was have Stanford Pines tossed out. The merger of their families was off. As far as he was concerned, this was a full and proper feud. It hardly mattered that Stan stole an expensive painting on the way out. Oh, there would be recompense and it would go far beyond petty thievery. This, Gideon knew with absolute certainty. He knew it because in a secret compartment at his desk, there was a book; an itty bitty minizora book. It bore no title. Just a little six fingered hand and the number 2 on the cover.
121312111111111111.title: Gideon's Rejection

1213121111111111111.content:
Over the next couple of days, Mabel was being especially clingy with Dipper, which he wasn’t too bothered by. They’d both gone through some pretty heavy stuff: him almost dying and her having to watch her most favorite person suffer. They were each other’s comfort object. Ever since they were little, their default response to any kind of stress had always been to seek out the other. That was the case now, with Dipper offering no complaint even when Mabel insisted on escorting or being escorted by him to the bathroom. And right now, the twins were undertaking a heavy emotional ordeal. They were going to be within two feet of one another, but not actually touch. This was an important step in their recovery process.
At the entrance to the gift shop, Mabel was sitting on a spinning globe. “Hehe. My butt is crushing Canada.”
“Mabel, do you believe in ghosts?” Dipper asked while flipping through the journal.
“I believe that you’re a big dork. Haha.” For her impudence, Dipper pressed a pencil into the globe, bringing it to an abrupt halt and sending his sister flying. “Ow.”
The bell rung and Stan poked his head in the door. “Soos. Wendy. I’m headin’ out. You two are going to wash the bathrooms, right?”
“Yes sir.” “Absolutely not,” they answered respectively, each with a firm salute.
“Haha. You stay out of trouble.” With his old man scowl delivered, Stan departed for parts unknown and deeds most likely of the extra-legal variety.
“Hey guys. What’s this?” Wendy called, gesturing over to a mysterious curtain in the corner. “Is it a secret ladder to the roof?” Pulling back the curtain, she revealed that it was just that.
Soos was reluctant, but the teen was easily able to bring the preteens onboard. She even showed them to her secret cot and cooler.
“Wow, did you put all this up here?” awed Dipper. “Huh. Funny I didn’t notice any of this when Sherloc-er, never mind.”
Wendy gave her hair a casual flip. “I may or may not sneak up here during work… all the time, every day.” She then grabbed a pinecone from a bucket and tossed it across the lot and hit a target that had been strapped to the plastic tiki tower. “Yes!”
“Oh I want to try,” squealed Mabel as she grabbed an armful and began chucking the things, each round coming up short.
Not wanting to be left out, Dipper figured he might as well try. His pinecone hit someone’s car and set off the alarm. At first his gut sank in fear that he’d just royally screwed up, but Wendy’s laugh said otherwise.
“Ha-ha-ha, jackpot!” Bending down with one hand on her knee, she extended her other palm down to Dipper’s level. “High five.”
Dipper suffered a momentary mental blue screen. The hand of someone other than a relative was reaching out for him in… comradery? What’s more, that hand was attached to a young woman with cute freckles and a lovely shade of red hair that was being picked up just right by the wind. And her smile…
“Don’t leave me hangin’.”
Dipper snapped out of it and delivered the high five. It was oddly exhilarating.
“Oh hey, it’s my friends,” Wendy said as a car pulled up. She then looked apprehensively at the twins. “Uh, you guys aren’t going to tell Stan, are you?”
With a resolute smile, Dipper made a zipping motion over his mouth and threw away the key, which Wendy mirrored. The teen then said “Later dorks,” before descending down some nearby trees with a level of prowess rarely seen outside of professional acrobats, or minizora.
“Later Wendy,” Dipper called after they’d already driven off. His laugh was forced and his waving was frantic. “Haaa, good times.”
“Uh oh,” beamed Mabel, not so oblivious when it came to other people’s relationships.
“What?”
“Somebody’s got a cru-hush,” she sang, poking him in the cheek.
“What? No. I just think Wendy’s cool is all. It’s not like I lay awake at night thinking about her.”
“Oh? So when I catch you staring blankly up at the ceiling at night, who are you thinking about?” inquired Mabel, continuing her poking assault.
“Her name’s Business. First name None-Ya.”
“You can’t fool me. I know when my little brother’s crushing on someone.”
“What? No you don’t.”
“Oh really? So if I were to, say, offer you this handkerchief that Wendy used to wipe her chest earlier,” Mabel said while producing said fabric from her pocket, “you wouldn’t be interested?”
“How much?” Dipper’s mouth said before his filter could switch on.
Mabel’s smirk was downright devilish. She had him cornered and they both knew it. “It’s actually clean,” she said before returning the white cloth to her pocket. “So, got a thing for red heads, huh?”
“No. I mean, I don’t know. Just… this one, I guess,” he admitted apprehensively. “C-can we just drop this, please?”
“Fine. Whatever you say, bro-bro. Just know that I’ll be here when you’re ready to talk. In fact…” Mabel then unceremoniously snatched up Dipper and stuffed him down the back of her underwear.
Wedged between her soft cheeks, Dipper was left to consider how surprisingly mature that response was, at least by Mabel standards. Still, with nothing better to do today, he decided to make himself comfy in the warm softness, pull out his flashlight and journal, and get some reading done.
The next day, Mabel seemed to have fully returned to her usual chipper self, as indicated by the “Random dance party for no reason!”
As she and Wendy got their groove on, Dipper pretended to read, all while peeking over the top of the journal. He was starting to notice things about the red head. Her dancing really showed off how nice her hips were. While she lacked the perpetual sugar rush that was Mabel’s energy, her moves had a more mature elegance. That one move resembled a pelvic thrust, which set the minizora’s imagination into overdrive.
“Hey Dipper. You gonna get in on this?” Wendy called.
“Oh, I, uh, don’t really dance,” Dipper dodged with a blush, only to spy the sadistic gleam in Mabel’s eye. She was about to do her sisterly duty and embarrass him for her own amusement.
“Yeah, ya do.” She turned to Wendy. “Mom used to dress him up in a lamb costume and make him do… the Lamby Dance,” she said as if imparting some ancient and holy secret.
“Now is not the time to talk about the Lamby Dance,” Dipper said through gritted teeth.
“Whoa, lamb costume?” Wendy chuckled. “Is there, like, little ears and a tail, or-?”
Mabel immediately produced a picture for Wendy. “He used to be so cute. He’d prance around and sing a song about grazing,” she laughed with nostalgic fondness.
“Oh wow.” Wendy covered a hand over her mouth to stifle her giggles. She understood how embarrassing this was, but couldn’t tear her eyes away. “Just look at him. Aww, he’s so sweet I think I just got diabetes.” While the ladies laughed, Dipper was left to seethe in silent humiliation.
Then the clock chimed.
“Op. Quitin’ time.” Wendy pocketed her name tag and made for the door.
“Uh, hey wait,” Dipper called. “Maybe I-er-we could come with you.”
“Ooh, I don’t know. My friends are pre-tty intense. How old did you guys say you are?”
“Uh, we’re thirteen, so technically teens,” Dipper lied.
“Alright. I like your moxy, kid. Let me get my stuff.”
Mabel picked Dipper up and tutted her disappointment. “Lying to a girl just to hang out. Oh Dipper. I thought I taught you better.”
“You’ve taught me literally nothing about dating… which this isn’t. It’s just one group of friends hanging out with another group of friends, all connected through one mutual friend. It’s all very friendly, and nothing else.”
“Uh huh. Yeah. Sure,” Mabel teased.
“Hey, quick question. Um, why are you being so cool about this?”
“What do you mean?”
“Like, I’m not saying I like Wendy or anything, but if I did, I kind of expected you to be a little more, you know…” He gestured vaguely.
“Finger bitey.”
“That’s a good way of putting it.”
Mabel laughed and shook her head at her pitiable little brother. “Because I realized something, Dipper. You and me, we kind of, how do I put this? Suck. Yeah. When it comes to love, we kind of have sucky tastes in picking people to crush on.”
Dipper scowled. “That sounds like the worst revelation ever.”
“Buuut, we don’t suck at judging the other’s love interests.”
“I’m not following.”
“It’s probably a twin thing. We started out as the same cell, but then we became two. I think it’s like we’ve got one whole person’s worth of common sense between us. I tend to miss a lot of stuff that’s obvious to you, but you’re basically blind to stuff I can’t not see. So whenever one of us finds someone we like, we should trust the other twin’s judgement instead of our own. That way we can avoid the awkwardness of gang banging gnomes, magic creepoids, or that one girl with chronic diarrhea.”
Dipper shuddered with revulsion. He’d have been happy to never think about Patty ever again. But in thinking of her now, Mabel had warned him beforehand. “Hmm. You know, that’s not the worst idea I’ve ever heard.”
“High praise.”
“So, if I’m following, does this mean you approve of Wendy?”
“Does she still have all her fingers?”
“Uh, yeah.”
“Then yeah. I like her fine.” Mabel emphasized by clicking her teeth together.
1213121111111111111.title: Someone's got a Crush

12131211111111111111.content:
The meeting with Wendy’s friends went less than ideal. Nothing Dipper did impressed anyone and he kind of pissed off Robbie by calling his drawing of an explosion a muffin. The rest of the guys were pretty rough with one another and prone to frequent punching. The only other girl, Tambry, was so glued to her phone that it was a miracle she could walk. Since the twins didn’t take up much space, they were made to sit in the back of Thompson’s mom’s van with Tambry.

“So, uh, you like spending time on your phone, huh?” Dipper asked awkwardly, trying to break the ice while sitting in Mabel’s lap.

Tambry finally paused in her texting to give the pair a once over. “So you’re, like, twins?”

“Uh, yup. Sure are.”

“So are you, like, identical?”

Mabel and Dipper shared a look. It was the look of people who’d been asked a particular question so often that they’d put serious thought into starting a petition to get that particular string of words criminalized.

“No, we’re not identical,” Dipper said as politely as possible. “We’re a boy and a girl, not to mention the whole height thing.”

“Yeah. Plus I’m the cute one,” Mabel added.

Tambry hummed thoughtfully. “So, I’ve never seen a minizora before. What’s that like? Do you, like, get stepped on a lot?”

“Kind of, but almost never twice by the same person.” Dipper then gestured up at Mabel. “Guess why.”

“Oh yeah. I saw a photo of that on BookFace.” Tambry flipped through her timeline and turned her phone towards the twins. Sure enough, there was a photo of Mabel frothing at the mouth and biting into Manly Dan’s ankle while he wore an expression of abject horror.

“It was actually whipped cream, but I think it sent the right message,” Mabel added, almost bragging.

Tambry finally smiled. “You guys aren’t half bad.” And she went back to texting.

The van finally pulled up at their destination and they all disembarked.

“There it is, fellas. The condemned Dust 2 Dawn,” Wendy ominously announced to the awe of the others. The building had been fenced off and looked like it hadn’t seen human activity in decades.

“Why’d they shut it down?” Dipper asked, not wanting to show his anxiety at entering another abandoned building. “Some kind of health code violation or…”

“Try murder,” said one of the guys whose name Dipper had already forgotten. “Some folks died in there. The place has been haunted ever since.”

“This town has such a colorful history,” Mabel cheered.

“Wh-wha? A-are you guys serious?”

“Chill out, man,” Wendy said before poking his arm, what she felt to be an appropriate equivalent of a friendly punch. “It’s not that big a deal.”

While everyone else had to climb the fence, Dipper was able to just walk between the holes. Unfortunately, the doors were locked, but then Dipper got an idea. “Hey, let me take a crack at it.”

Robbie scoffed. “Yeah right. I can’t get in, but itty bitty pipsqueak is gonna break it down like-Agh!” He winced as a can hit him in the face. “Who threw that?”

No one gave any response; least of all Mabel who was innocently whistling.

“Come on, leave him alone,” Wendy pleaded. “He’s just a little kid.”

Dipper’s expression of hurt quickly morphed into determination and he snapped his fingers. “Mabel.” She manifested behind him. “Roof me.”

With a wide grin at the chance to show off their twin skills, Mabel picked up her brother. With him curled up in a ball, she took aim at what looked like a vent and tossed him. Everyone else was gob smacked, unable to believe what they were seeing as the little fella climbed. Mabel had only thrown him half way up, meaning he’d have to make the rest of the ascension on his own while the others watched. He disappeared. There was a commotion on the roof, like metal being punched, and then came silence.

Robbie scoffed and turned to the others. “Who wants to bet he doesn’t-”

“$100!” Mabel shouted urgently.

“Pssh. Like he’ll actually-”

With the door unlocked from the inside, Dipper was able to push it open and motion the others to enter. While the others congratulated the minizora, even giving him the nickname Dr. Funtimes, Mabel stuck by Robbie’s side.

“We can discuss a payment plan later. I’d prefer cash, but I’m willing to settle for the equivalent in fingers and toes.” Her ultimatum delivered, she merrily skipped on into the haunted shop.

“Oh man. It’s even creepier than I imagined,” commented Wendy as the group split up to explore the dark isles.

Everything was covered in dust and there were more than a few bugs scurrying about. The whole experience of a convenience store at night was pretty novel for all of them. It wasn’t long before Wendy found the light switches and, much to everyone’s surprise, they still worked. With that set, the games were on. They had a food war with expired pastries, dropped mints in soda bottles just because, and did pretty much whatever else they wanted.

Then Mabel squealed. “Oh my gosh, Smile Dip! I thought this stuff was banned in America.”

“Maybe they had a good reason,” Dipper observed responsibly. All the tape wrapped around the display saying ‘Do Not Sell’ seemed to predate the store’s closing. But the cheering of the teens throwing liquefied food at one another called him back to the fun, leaving Mabel to her own devices.

Up on one of the isle shelves, Dipper and Wendy were enjoying some (miraculously) still frozen ice cream sticks. After an initial period of awkwardness, Dipper agreed to sit on her knee.

“Haha. Dipper, this night is, like, legendary.”

“Really?”

“Just look around. The guys are bonding.” She pointed to where they were pouring ice into Thompson’s pants. “I’ve never even seen Tambry look up from her phone this long.” Tambry just looked up to check on the shelf sitters, but looked away the moment their eyes locked. “And your sister seems to be going nuts for that Smile Dip.” Pink sugary stuff stained Mabel’s hair and clothes. Her eyes looked glazed over as she seemed to be imagining eating something very large. It was unsettling to look at.

“You know, Dipper. I wasn’t sure if you could hang out with our crew at first, but you’re surprisingly mature for your age.”

“Yes. Yes I am, though that’s probably just cuz I’m a minizora.”

“Oh yeah. I think I heard that somewhere. You little guys mature, like, super quick or something.” That was the SFW version, though. When Wendy had read about this online, there had been lots of comments talking about the sexual side of things. Something about them evolving to develop early to ensure survival. There’d been a lot of talk about hormones, or maybe it was pheromones. Lots of people were arguing on the particulars. The overall conclusion was that even if a minizora kid looked like any regular kid on the outside, on the inside they were, like, twice as old. In that sense, depending on how you looked at it, Dipper was kind of like an adult in a little kid’s body. Wendy wondered if this new info made her feelings towards the little dude less or more awkward. Probably the latter.

“Yeah, definitely,” Dipper agreed, oblivious to Wendy’s inner turmoil. He was glad that from his position, he could sneak glances of her chest without her noticing.
12131211111111111111.title: The Inconveniencing

121312111111111111111.content:
Dipper had gone to fetch some more ice cream for everyone. “It’s really a shame this place shut down,” he said to himself as he opened the freezer door. “Not many places are this minizora friendly. I wonder if-” His train of thought was broken when he beheld a floating brain. The nervous system floated beneath it like the tendrils of a jelly fish, along with a gurgling mouth and a pair of eyes that got way too close. Naturally, Dipper screamed and shut the door before anything else could happen.
Then the teens all came over to investigate. “What was that? I thought I heard some lady screaming back here.” Said one of the no-names. “You freaking out kid?” asked the other no-name.
“No, no. I’m fine. Everything’s fine over here. Um, how are you?” Dipper’s eyes nervously darted about in search of some sort of distraction. “Hey look. Dancy Pants Revolution, the game that tricks people into exercising.” That worked and the teens all rushed over to play. After taking one last look inside the freezer and finding it empty, Dipper decided that it had just been some trick of the light and rejoined the teens.
Dipper’s smile was forced as he tried to play it cool. Then he looked at the reflective glass and saw everyone – including himself – as skeletons. He then slapped himself and the reflections went back to normal. “I’ll be right back.” He tried to phone Grunkle Stan. The good news was that it was minizora accessible. The bad news was that no one was picking up.
Dipper then returned to Mabel. He climbed on her palm and her fingers reflexively curled around him in a protective embrace. “Mabel, I need your help. I think this store really is haunted, I can’t get ahold of Grunkle Stan, and if I say anything to these guys,” he gestured to the teens, “then they’ll just think I’m a scared little kid or something. Uh, Mabel?” Her only answer was a low gurgle as pink foam poured from her lips. Dipper then climbed up to her shoulder and started slapping her cheek. “Mabel, how many of these did you eat?”
“Eleven… teeeeen. Blagh!”
“Oh man-oh man-oh man!” Dipper shook his hands as his body felt hot and cold all at once. They were in danger and his other half was in a sugar induced coma. How could things get worse?
Robbie then called everyone over behind the counter. There were a couple of chalk outlines of where the bodies had fallen. Everyone was impressed and, in typical teen fashion, decided to prove their bravery by getting inside the lines.
“Wait!” Dipper urged, positioning himself between the teens and what was definitely a bad idea. “Maybe let’s not do that.”
“Heh-heh. This guy’s scared.”
“All I’m saying is: Why tempt the fates? I mean, what if this place really is… haunted?” The fallout was as bad as he’d feared. Everyone was booing, his nickname was changed to Captain Buzzkill, and worst of all, Wendy looked disappointed with him.
Tambry just kept texting. “Status update. Trapped in convenience store with insane 9 year old.”
“I’m not 9!” Dipper stomped his foot like a petulant child and, also like a child, surrendered to peer pressure by laying down in the chalk outline. “I’m 13. Technically a teen.”
With his announcement made, it was like the whole store gave a groan. The lights turned an eerie green and the chalk outline began to glow. The change in scenery caused Tambry to look up from her phone just in time to vanish in a blinding flash.
“Whoa, what the hell?”
Dipper ran over and checked her phone. “Status update. Ahhh,” he read. Then the security camera flipped on with the girl inside and trying to break out of the glass. Everyone had the appropriate reaction of screaming like a bunch of sissies.
Thompson, who was still playing on the machine, was the next to vanish. He reappeared within the game screen and was pummeled by arrows. With nowhere to run, he curled up in a ball and started to cry. Tension only escalated when the doors closed on their own and no amount of force could break through.
“Everybody wait,” Dipper called, pulling out the journal and flipping to the ghost section. “Whatever is doing this has to have some kind of reason. If we can figure out what it is, thennn maybe they’ll let us go.”
When the white no-name made a sarcastic remark, his reward was to be transported within the art of a cereal box where the bird mascot tried to eat him.
Then, just as everyone was onboard with the only actual plan, Mabel floated about six feet above the ground. She had no pupils, her body glowed, and she spoke with a deep masculine voice. “Wel-commme.”
“They got Mabel!” Dipper cried.
“Welcome to your graves, young trespassers. Mwahahaha!”
“Look, we’re super sorry for hanging out in your store,” Wendy pleaded.
“Yeah. Can’t we just go now and leave forever?” begged Dipper.
The ghost possessing Mabel hummed. “Hmm. Okay, you’re free to go.” The doors opened. However, just as the guys tried to run, they were sealed shut all over again. “Ha! Just kidding.”
“You creepy freak! Just let us out already,” demanded the black no-name.
“Yeah, loser,” Robbie agreed.
“I don’t like your tone.” The ghost snapped Mabel’s fingers, turning the disrespectful teens into hot dogs and putting them on the rollers to cook. “It begins.” Gravity decided to take the day off as everything fell to the ceiling.
Wendy winced in pain. “Agh! Dipper. Dipper, where’d you go?”
“In here,” called a voice from within her shirt. In the fall, Dipper had somehow been wedged waste deep between Wendy’s boobs. Were they not in such great peril, they’d have both been more embarrassed. With the items of the store now swirling in a whirlwind, Dipper directed Wendy to run into an empty soda machine for safety.
Secure inside, Wendy caught her breath with her hand against her chest, along with the boy. Ever since meeting Dipper, she’d been secretly fantasizing about this exact thing happening; only in the fantasy she’d been a lot cooler and able to enjoy the moment without ghosts trying to kill them. “What do they want from us?”
“Revenge, I guess,” Dipper suggested while he tried to wiggle free. Wendy’s breasts were a lot bigger than they appeared through her casual clothes, and the way she was lying down squished them together pretty tightly. The rapid rise and fall of her chest made it hard for the little guy to keep his balance and he kept having to brace himself on his hands. He was touching her boobs, and they were warm.
“What did we do?” Wendy demanded of her boob sitter. Despite her panic, the little guy’s struggling against her sensitive area was causing her body to react very unfortunately. Her only hope was that he didn’t notice and think she was some kind of pervert.
The two had a back and forth until Dipper figured out the pattern. Everyone had been taken after doing ‘normal teen things’. “That’s it. Stay here until I get back.” Before she could stop him, he’d already hopped out of her shirt and hurried out onto the main floor/ceiling. “Hey ghost! I’ve got something to tell you,” he declared even as he was lifted up into the air. This whole thing was giving him some seriously bad flashbacks, but he still had a mission to complete and a sister to save. “I’m not a teenager!”
And just like that, the magic faded. The ceiling was still the new floor, but everything still dropped, including him and Mabel. Then a couple of ghosts – a man and woman in their late eighties – manifested. Were they not transparent and floating, their smiles would be quite charming.
“Well why didn’t you say so?” asked the man with a good-natured laugh. “How old did you say you were?”
Mindful of Wendy’s eyes upon him, Dipper sucked in a breath. “I’m… twelve. Technically not a teen.”
The ghosts then told their backstory. They hated how teens behaved in their store, eventually getting so fed up that they banned them all. In retaliation, the teens had some kind of rap battle dance off in the parking lot. The lyrics were so ‘hateful’ and ‘shocking’ that the pair were stricken with double heart attacks. It was the most tragically hilarious thing the minizora had ever heard.
“But, they’re my friends. Isn’t there anything I can do to help them?” pleaded Dipper.
In fact, there was. These ghosts wanted to see a minizora do a funny dance. When Dipper let slip that he knew one, they were even generous enough to provide him a lamb costume. As the minizora swallowed his dignity and humiliated himself before these strangers, Wendy was enduring her own brand of suffering. Seeing such a cute boy in such a silly costume was unbearable to behold, but she couldn’t tear her eyes away. She had to resort to biting her arm until blood was drawn to keep her imagination from wandering. She’d think about it later, though.
“That was some fine girly dancing,” congratulated the ghost. “Your friends are free.”
The lights returned to normal, as did gravity. Everything fell back to the old floor and the formerly captive teens crawled out of the wreckage, all suffering the spectral equivalent of a hangover.
“Evil,” Mabel burbled, her stomach expressing its hatred for her as she stared at a pink package. “Eeeviiil.”
With everyone still disoriented, Wendy saw fit to tell the story. Once the ghosts appeared, Dipper MacGuivered an array of slingshots that propelled him all around the room. He was like the world’s deadliest pinball and battered the ghosts until they ran away crying. While everyone was in awe, Wendy turned back to Dipper and made the zipping motion, which he returned.
On the ride back, Mabel was amazingly able to keep from spewing. Dipper, meanwhile, was thinking of Wendy. She’d been impressed by him, covered for him, expressed an interest in hanging out further, and her chest had been so soft. So… soft. All in all, he’d had worse nights.
121312111111111111111.title: The Lamby Horror

1213121111111111111111.content:
Grunkle Stan was in the middle of selling literal garbage to a local, who really ought to have known better, when the twins came in.

“Grunkle Stan, can we go to the diner? We’re huuungryyy,” Mabel pleaded, pinching her stomach and shaking it. Soon dipper started doing the same as both made sounds like they were dying. “If I don’t get something in my tummy quick, I might have to eat Dipper.”

“She ain’t bluffing, man,” deadpanned the minizora. Mabel had only ever swallowed Dipper by accident. The exception being that first time back when they were three and she was trying to get him away from some bullies. Later, after he’d been spit up and cleaned, she’d apologized until she lost her voice. Even so, it was fun to freak people out with the threat.

Stan agreed, leaving the idiot locked in the gift shop. Greasy’s Diner was a local joint with a lot of character, which was a nice way of saying it wasn’t up to code. There were even woodpeckers and beavers chewing on the wood. Their server was Lazy Susan, a woman about Stan’s age with a dysfunctional left eyelid. After some rather forced banter, Stan ordered the cheapest item on the menu for himself and leftovers for Dipper and Mabel to split.

“But Grunkle Stan, I want pancakes,” whined Mabel.

The old man was as stingy as ever, but then Dipper saw his chance to shine. At the far end of the room was a machine called Test Your Manliness, with the promise of free pancakes for winners. Cracking his knuckles, he said, “Don’t worry guys. Pancakes are on me. I’ll win us some by beating that manliness tester.”

After a second of disbelief, both Mabel and Stan burst out laughing.

“What? What’s so funny? It’s got a setting for minizora, so I can do it.”

“Sorry Dipper, but you’re not exactly Manly Manington,” cackled Mabel.

“Hey. I am so Manly… Many or whatever.”

“Face the music, kid,” Stan lectured. “Even by tiny people standards you’ve got no muscle, you smell like baby wipes,” he didn’t notice Mabel’s eyes guiltily darting around, “and let’s not forget last Tuesday’s… incident.”

“Hey, Baba is awesome, but that doesn’t matter. Come on, guys. I’m plenty masculine. Look at this chest hair.” He pulled down his shirt, catching the mid-morning light just right and magnifying it back at his family.

“Ahh! My eyes!”

“It burrrns!”

Blushing, Dipper decided that he was getting nowhere with just words. “Fine, oh family of little faith. Get ready to eat those words, with a side of pancakes.”

Dipper hopped down and marched over to the machine, climbing the little staircase on the side to the minizora setting. It had a scaled down handle and everything. Channeling the strength that had defeated gnomes, wax dummies, and a small army of bugs across the years, Dipper grabbed that handle and squeezed with all his might. The bottommost bulb blinked and the machine spat out a card, which Dipper thoughtlessly read aloud. “Cutie patootie?”

Mabel screamed, burying her face in her sleeve and banging on the table as tears poured from her eyes.

Manly Dan, in a rare moment of sympathy for the pipsqueak, decided to do the poor kid a favor. After gently setting him down on the ground, careful not to provoke the wrath of the minizora’s rabid guard dog, the man ape pushed his pinkie against the lever. The machine overloaded and pancakes were flung out to every plate in the diner. “Pancakes for everyone!” While everyone cheered at his display, Manly Dan checked on the person he actually wanted to impress.

Mabel gestured for him to move along, so he did; but only because it was his decision, dammit!

Dipper just sat on the floor, picking up the pieces of his shattered masculinity, when a red head showed up. She wasn’t the one from the Shack, though. This lady was much older, maybe early thirties. She looked like a super model with an hourglass figure, tremendous tits, and a luscious ass that Dipper wouldn’t mind sitting on him. Who just thought that?

She squatted down closer to Dipper’s level, thankfully wearing pants. “Hey there, sugar. Don’t let yourself get down, none.” Her voice was like honey. “Say, yer that Dipper kid Wendy told me about,” she inquired, reaching down with her thumb and trigger finger to shake.

Dipper swallowed what felt like a lung and accepted the offer. “Oh, uh, Wendy t-told you about me?”

“She sure did. Mah little girl said you were quite the hero the other night.”

“Oh, so you’re Wendy’s mom.” Dipper forced a smile, remembering that this was the woman with the power to make guys fling themselves out of closed windows.

“Don’t mind mah husband, none. He’s just got his own special way of showin’ he cares.”

“That’s, aha, nice to hear, but doesn’t help much.” Dipper gestured up at the machine. “Even by tiny standards, I’m a wimp.”

Mrs. Corduroy smiled flatly. “Ya really shouldn’t listen to what some dumb machine has to say. There are lots of ways to be a real man, even for a minizora. Ya just have to find the one that fits yer style.”

“I appreciate that. I really do, but I think I just need some alone time to figure things out.”

“Well, suit yerself.” She stood and was about to walk away, but stopped herself. “Just one more thing. If ya happen on some still water ‘n’ see yer reflection in it, don’t sing. Only princesses do that, ‘n’ that’s about as far from manly as anyone can get.”

Dipper laughed, once more thanking the woman for her kindness, and departed.

Grunkle Stan turned to Mabel. “You just gonna let him go like that?”

“He’d just tell me not to follow,” Mabel sighed. “He’s trying to be more independent and I’m trying to let him. Our therapist said it’d be healthier for both of us.”

“Egh. Head doctors are all quacks if you ask me, though I guess this one’s not totally wrong. A lucky minizora has family that’ll look after them, but things can sometimes go overboard. Ya get overprotective, smothering, and worry yourself sick. A little distance here and there really is for the best for all sides. Gives them some independence from feeling stifled and gives you a break from worrying.” Grunkle Stan then took a sip of his coffee.

“Wow. That’s almost exactly what our therapist said.” Mabel’s awe then turned to suspicion. “How do you know so much about minizora?”

Stan averted his gaze. “Oh, you know. A guy my age hears things. No big deal.”

“Makes sense to me,” allowed Mabel, fully accepting of this explanation.
1213121111111111111111.title: Manly Mini

“No, but it turns out the Yates may be voyeurs.” Clyde handed her his binoculars and pointed to the window in question.

Ronnie Anne stared at said window for quite a while before putting the binoculars down, cheeks flushed. “It still weirds me out how not weirded out you guys are with stuff like this.”

“With my family, strangers getting off while they watch us is pretty mundane,” Lincoln explained evenly.

“And I just had my first vore experience with Leni,” Clyde boasted. “Clyde the boy is no more. From now on, you can call me Clyde the MAN!”

Ronnie Anne looked unimpressed. “Oh hey, is that a stain on your shirt?”

“There is?” Clyde looked down, only to get his nose flicked. Now it was his turn to look unimpressed as Ronnie Anne mocked his gullibility.

“So you finally popped your vore cherry, huh? That’s cool,” she said after working the snickers out of her system. “Is it actually as good as they say?”

“Better,” Clyde confirmed. “All that stuff about a full body massage. That doesn’t even come close to how great it is.”

“If you’re curious,” Lincoln trailed off and motioned up to his house.

“Thanks, but no thanks, Linc. I think I’ll take a page out of their book,” she gestured at the Yates’ place, “and just stick to watching.”

It was Lincoln’s turn to smile coyly. “You know they’re doing more than watching, right?”

“Hey, don’t get any funny ideas.” Ronnie blushed and pointed a threatening finger in Lincoln’s face. “I might like you, but I don’t like you.”

Sensing weakness, Lincoln decided to press the attack. “You’re not still afraid to come in my house, are you?” he asked of the stunned Hispanic girl. “I told you, I cleared it up with my sisters. They accepted your apology, so now we can all be friends without fear of digestion.”

Ronnie pursed her lips and looked away. “Whatever. And for the record, I was never afraid. You’re family’s just a little… overwhelming.”

“Understatement of the century,” agreed Clyde. “It’s basically impossible to spend 5 minutes in that house without someone licking you.”

“I know, right. And I know I’m not exactly one to talk on the matter, but it’s like no one in that house has any concept of personal space,” Ronnie added.

“When almost half your time is spent inside another person, personal space is more theoretical than anything,” Lincoln offered helpfully. “Seriously, my mom and sisters’ collective stomachs are like a second room to me at this point.”

“Man, that’s so wild,” awed Ronnie. Admittedly, she was a little curious. Between Lincoln and Bobby, it was impossible to not be. Months back, Ronnie had almost made a grave mistake when she started picking on Lincoln for reasons she still didn’t fully understand. Had she been a boy, his sisters would have digested her for sure, but luckily they all thought her actions were just a misguided attempt at flirting. They so weren’t, though, and the girls’ patience was wearing thin. It wasn’t long before Lynn and Lucy started dropping hints in the halls that her ‘flirting’ was too aggressive for their liking. When Lori came over with Bobby, she was even less subtle, saying in no uncertain terms that if Lincoln ever got hurt because of her, then the blonde would literally digest her while fucking Bobby. That was about the time that Ronnie realized she’d been poking a sleeping bear.

Luckily, that was all behind them. The pair found that they had a good bit in common and became friends. However, simply being off the menu didn’t stop her growing fascination with vore. The Louds weren’t just the local pseudo celebrities that she could keep a safe distance from anymore. They were a part of her life now and the things they did were frequently in her face. If it wasn’t someone with a bloated stomach, it was casual nudity. If it wasn’t that, then it was how she could no longer tune out seemingly everyone around her talking about their own weird obsessions with the family. And to top it off, Lincoln Loud, her best guy friend, effectively had zero sense of shame when it came to talking about sex and vore. It always left Ronnie feeling weird, though she still wasn’t sure if it was a bad kind of weird.

“Anyway,” Lincoln spoke up, startling Ronnie back to reality. “We were just playing spies. Want to join us? You could be our arch nemesis.”

Ronnie frowned. “How come I have to be the bad guy?”

“Because of the three of us, you have the best evil laugh.”

Ronnie opened her mouth to protest, only to reconsider and shrug. “Touché.”

Some minutes later, and the boys were chasing the evil Dr. Angela up and down the street. Her doom buggy might have given her speed, but the boys had range with the deadliest of nerf guns. More than once she tried weaving through houses to throw them off, but the grass lawns always cut down on her speed and let the boys catch up. It was all a ploy, however, as she also had superior maneuverability that left her pursuers in the dust. Any pretense of being spies had been abandoned for a variation of tag, but at least everyone was having fun.

“How’s it going, Stinken?” greeted Lynn, dressed for the outdoors, as she came up on her dirt bike. “Looks to me like you’re finally on the fun side of the hunt.” She looked over to Ronnie who had come to a halt a few yards ahead, and licked her lips. “I can see why you’re chasing her. She looks yummy.”

“It’s not like that,” Lincoln said in exasperation, oblivious to Ronnie’s hot blush. “We’re playing spies, not hunters.”

Lynn didn’t seem to care. “Spies hunt all the time, and it looks like you’re at the part of the movie with the big chase scene. Also looks like your prey’s a wily one. Those that play hard to get are always the most fun to chase. If you’d like, I could give you a few pointers on how to catch her, just so long as I get a share of the spoils.”

“There are no spoils, Lynn. Clyde and I are spies chasing the evil Dr. Angela before she can flood the world.”

“What are you a doctor of, exactly?” Lynn called over to Ronnie.

“I got my PHD in BS, though my specialty is putting nerds in their place.”

Lynn turned to Lincoln with an even wider grin. “Oh yeah. That one’s definitely worth chasing.” Then she turned to Clyde and looked him over. “So, now that Leni’s taken your vore cherry, does that mean you’re available for the Lynn Miester?” she asked while rubbing her stomach, earning a nose bleed from Clyde.

Though she still found the Louds super weird, seeing Lynn tease Clyde like that put Ronnie at ease, bizarre as that might have been. It helped to normalize the athletic Loud. That certainly would have been the sort of thing Ronnie would do if she were a predator and, ya know, into that stuff.

Where do things go from here?

Lynn joins the game.
Lynn leaves them to keep playing.
They go inside.
They go to Ronnie Anne’s place.
131121132121111111111111111111111.title: Hello Ronnie Anne

1311211321211111111111111111111111.content:
Clyde got a call on his cell and everyone waited for him to finish. “Sorry guys. My dads booked tickets to Les Mis and I almost forgot. Looks like we’re going to have to pick things up later.”

“Hey, no problem.” Lincoln shared a fist bump with Clyde before he ran home. “See you at school, buddy.” He waved goodbye and turned to his sister and other friend, looking thoughtful. “Lynn, since I’m down a partner…”

“I can play!?” she gushed excitedly.

“Only if you promise not to eat Ronnie,” he said authoritatively.

Lynn puttered her lips in defeat. “Fine, but we both know my way’s way more fun.”

Ronnie smiled at Lincoln coming to her defense. He might have been a dork, but he was also a pretty cool guy… not that she’d ever say so to his face. Everyone took their new positions to resume the chase. Lincoln yammered some in-game explanation for why he had to change partners, but Ronnie barely paid any attention. Lynn had agreed to leave her bike behind, but she was known as the athletic Loud for a reason. Even on foot, she posed an imminent threat. Ronnie could no longer afford to slow down to taunt her pursuers. Now the tables had turned and it was Lynn doing the taunting, always getting just close enough to grab Ronnie, only to break off at the last minute.

Ronnie’s heart raced each time the athlete drew near. Lynn’ smile also proved infectious, much to her prey’s annoyance. Despite herself, Ronnie was actually having fun being chased. She was still determined not to get caught and risk Lynn breaking Lincoln’s rule, but that just added a layer of excitement. Speaking of… “Whaaa!”

*CRASH*

“Ohhh…” Ronnie and Lincoln groaned as they lay tangled in a heap. Ronnie had been so focused on Lynn as she drove her skateboard up and down the road, she’d completely lost track of Lincoln. Between his sister’s athletic prowess and Ronnie’s wheels, the boy had fallen so far behind that he’d wound up ahead of them both, leading to the collision.

Lynn came to a halt over the pair, set her hands on her hips, and looked on with an appraising eye. “Whoa, that looks like it hurts. Hehe. Not a bad crash, Stinken. You make an excellent speed bump,” she praised.

“Ugh. Am I bleeding?”

Lynn rolled her eyes and checked her brother over with her hands. “Nah, you’re fine. Too bad. A few scars could’ve toughened you up.” She turned to inspect Ronnie, feeling her up far more than was probably necessary. “Same to you, though I’ve got to say you’ve got a nice body.”

Ronnie blushed. “I… what?”

“Yeah. You were rocking that board before. I can tell you must practice often. It really shows with the muscle balance. There’s room for improvement, but when is there not, am I right?” Lynn laughed. “How come you don’t try out for sports? I’m on, like, all of them for my age, but I get the feeling you’d be top of the league for your age.”

Ronnie smiled bashfully. “That’s nice of you to say, but I’m really not much of a team player, ya know.” She picked up her board and gave it a spin. “I’m more of a solo act, if you get my drift.”

“I hear ya loud and clear, sister.” Lynn laughed, which turned into a groan. “I’ve been hanging out with Luan too much. But there are still plenty of solo things you can try out for. I’ve been trying to get this knuckle head,” she pulled Lincoln into a headlock, “to join a racing team since second grade. His endurance might not be the best, but he knows how to call on some mad energy for short bursts of speed.”

“No kidding,” Ronnie replied, a little suspicious. “Where was that a few minutes ago? I was skating circles around you guys.”

Lincoln pursed his lips and averted his gaze. “I… didn’t want to leave Clyde behind. Then the game just kept going, and I guess I got tired.”

“Aww,” Lynn cooed as she gave Lincoln an affectionate noogy. “My little bro’s got team spirit after all.” Then she turned to Ronnie with a lascivious grin. “To be clear, when I say his endurance needs work, I’m talking about when his legs are moving. On his knees or on his back, and he can go for a stupid long time.”

“Lynnnn!” Lincoln whined as he tried to pull free. “You’re embarrassing me.”

Lynn stared blankly at him for a couple seconds before her coy grin returned. “And?” She laughed when he slumped in her grasp. “Aww, don’t take it so hard, bro.” She set him back on his feet and let him go. “That’s my job, remember? Bow-chica-wow-wow!”

Ronnie had never considered herself a very imaginative sort, but right now her mind was tormenting her with all manner of horrific scenarios. All of them involved Lincoln being naked with his family. Said thoughts were making her feel all tingly.

Then Lynn had a lightbulb moment. “Say, since we were both the hunters chasing our prey-”

“Not prey,” Lincoln interjected.

“-and you caught her, that means she’s yours to do with whatever you want,” she finished with a suggestive eyebrow wiggle.

Lincoln rolled his eyes. “Lynn, we’re playing spies, remember. When we catch the bad guy, we thwart her evil scheme which, in this case, was to take over the world.”

“Y-yeah,” Ronnie added nervously. “The day is saved. Yippee,” she cheered weakly.

Lynn shook her head. “No can do, bro. You know how these movies work. The best villains always come back in the sequels. If you want to save the world, you’re gonna have to lock this bad guy up somewhere she’ll never escape.”

“Lynn, stop it. I said you couldn’t eat her, so stop trying.”

“I know, but you saying I can’t just makes me want her more.” She looked past Lincoln and exaggeratedly licked her lips at Ronnie. “C’mon, girl. I can tell you’re curious. We can take it super slow and I’ll go any position you want.”

“No! Bad Lynn!” Lincoln pulled out a squirt bottle and sprayed Lynn in the face until she backed down. He positioned himself defensively between the girls. “Convincing is one thing, but you can’t go around pressuring people like that.”

“What? Yes I can,” Lynn asserted, holding her hands up like a shield. “I do it all the time.”

“Yeah, but with your friends, not mine. Now back off.” Lincoln sprayed her in the face again, making his sister hiss like a cat before grabbing her bike and scurrying off. Lincoln gave a relieved sigh and turned back to his friend, puzzled as to why her cheeks were so red. “Uh, you okay?”

“Y-yeah. I mean…” Ronnie rubbed the back of her neck. “No one’s ever defended me like that before. And I don’t think anyone’s ever fended off a Loud like that.”

Smirking, Lincoln tried spinning the spray bottle like he was a cowboy doing tricks with his pistol, only to fumble and send it flying. “Dang it.”

“I’ll get it,” Ronnie offered, running into the grass.

“Thanks, but it’s really not a big deal. My sisters can be pretty persistent when they want to eat someone, especially me, but you just have to know how to talk to them. With Lynn, if the spray bottle didn’t work, I had this.” Lincoln reached into his pocket and pulled out a red ball.

“Whoa, that’s impressive. And also hilarious,” Ronnie chuckled as she returned the bottle. “Is your sister part dog or something?”

“It’s a possibility that we’ve discussed many times in family meetings,” Lincoln admitted. “Actually, how about we trade. The ball for the bottle. That way if Lynn ever gives you trouble again, you can defend yourself.”

“What, really? But…”

“No worries. I have a bunch more stored in my room. The bottle’s more valuable, anyway. I just have to say its soapy water and Lana can’t run away fast enough.”

Ronnie chuckled as they made the exchange. “Whoa, dude. I know you like to call yourself the man with the plan, but I thought it was just some cheesy nickname. I didn’t realize you’d actually earned that title.” She regarded the ball and slipped it into her hoody’s pocket.

What does she say next?

Let’s go to your place.
Let’s go to my place.
Smell ya later.
What’s that over there?
1311211321211111111111111111111111.title: Lincoln to Ronnie Anne's Defense

13112113212111111111111111111111111.content:
Ronnie swallowed audibly. “So, uh, get any good video games recently?”

“Not for a few weeks, but Lucy got me on the first volume of a new comic. So far it’s got a promising start. Ya wanna read it with me?” Lincoln offered without a second thought.

“Yes,” Ronnie squeaked, but with countless second thoughts.

“Cool. I left my copy up in my room.” Lincoln motioned Ronnie to follow him, taking several steps before finally realizing what he was doing, but not the full scope of things. “You’re cool with coming inside, right?”

Just then, a paper plane flew out of the window. It caught the wind just right as it flew right into Ronnie’s hands. She unfolded it and read aloud. “That’s what she said. Then there’s a heart and its signed Luan.” She looked up at Lincoln before crumbling and tossing the paper. “Yeah, actually. I mean, so long as you’re there to keep your sisters in line, I guess I can-” She was cut short by a hand pressed against her mouth. Lincoln’s face was frighteningly close to her and he was shushing her urgently.

“Never say that when they’re in earshot!” Lincoln whispered. “They’ll take it as a challenge.”

“But… we’re not even on your property yet.” Ronnie motioned to the pavement.

“Just trust me, alright. My mom and sisters have their ways of knowing these things. Just… try to act normal. Don’t show fear, but don’t be too confident, either. There’s… a lot of ways to provoke my sisters, though usually they’re pretty behaved when company is over… relatively speaking.” He smiled awkwardly. “So, uh, about those comics.”

Ronnie Anne, despite every nerve in her body screaming to take the hint and just start running, replied. “Y-yeah. Let’s get to reading.”

Entering the Loud house was pretty much exactly what one might expect from the name. Lots of noise from shouts, laughter, whirring from the kitchen, the revving of a drivable toy car for kids, and what Ronnie was certain was an explosion. The girls of the house, the predators, were all doing their own thing and, much to Ronnie’s relief, barely paid her a second glance. Lincoln suddenly grabbed her by the hand and started pulling her up the stairs. She followed, mindful to heed his advice about keeping calm without looking overconfident. She also tried to not make it too obvious that she was huddling close to Lincoln for protection.

“So, what’s this book about, anyway?”

“Vampires of Melancholia, or VoM for short. It’s a soap opera about vampires. The characters are really glum all the time, but they face some interesting supernatural drama.”

“That sounds pretty neat. So what does it-oof! Hey, what gives?” She demanded irately. Lincoln had just stopped at the top of the stairs, resulting in her bumping into him.

Lincoln said nothing. He merely motioned for Ronnie to stay back as he ascended the final step onto the second floor. When nothing happened, he looked around, only to appear disappointed. “Typical. The one time I’m actually ready for Lucy, and she’s not even here.”

“Hey Lincoln.”

“Ahh!” Lincoln jumped back. “Luan!?”

“Aw, don’t be scared, little brother. You know my bite is worse than my bark. Or was it the reverse? I get the two mixed up sometimes.” Luan laughed and then clicked her teeth together in a chomp. “Oh, hey Ronnie Anne. Haven’t seen you in a while. Did you get my message?”

“Oh yeah. That was funny,” Ronnie affirmed, mostly to keep the peace.

“Oh, c’mon. Don’t be such a stiff.” In the blink of an eye, Luan had closed the distance and pulled the younger girl into a bone constricting embrace. She also pressed her face into the younger girls neck, took a deep inhale, and gave a brief lick. “Mmh. You’re tasting awful yummy today. What’s the occasion?”

Lincoln cleared his throat and gently pulled Ronnie away from Luan. “We’re going to my room to read my new VoM comic.”

Luan’s eyes lit up. “The one with the vampires and the werewolves. Well, have you checked her yet?”

“Checked for what?”

“If she’s a werewolf, duh. You don’t want to find out after the full moon’s already risen. Haha. Get it?”

Ronnie frowned. “I… really don’t.”

“Linky likes to read comics in his undies,” Leni informed plainly as she strutted by and down the stairs, dressed only in a pair of shoes, sunglasses, and a purse. “You two have fun. I’m off to the mall.”

“Leniii!” Rita chided. “No nudity outside the house. Get that tight butt back upstairs and put some clothes on.”

“Oops. Sorry mom.” Leni hurried back up and down the hall to her room, though she was mindful to give her hips an added sway when she noticed who all was staring.

Ronnie had suffered a blue screen moment and was left gawking at the top of the stairs. So much had happened so quickly that she was having trouble processing it all. Luan… undies… Lincoln… dat ass! It was too much, too fast.

Lincoln, having seen this look before, took Ronnie’s hand and hurried her into his room where they were less likely to be bothered by his sisters. He closed the door behind them, just in time to miss the roaring of chainsaws from Lisa’s room.

Ronnie finally snapped out of her stupor. “Wha…? What happened? How’d I get here?”

“Sorry. Looks like you experienced an overdose of Loud,” diagnosed Lincoln. He pressed his forehead to hers to check her temperature. “Hmm. A little warm, but I don’t think it’s anything to worry about. So, uh, welcome to casa Lincoln.” He opened his arms to indicate his room.

It was all coming back to Ronnie as she looked around. This was the place Lincoln slept. She was now alone, with a boy, in his room, while a pack of rabid predators stalked the halls just outside. This had not been her smartest idea. “It’s, uh, kind of small,” she said, trying to distract herself.

Lincoln shrugged. “Yeah. It’s actually a converted closet, but I’m the only one in the house with his own room, so I take what I can get.” He looked around and wondered where he should start his little tour. “Uh oh.”

“What?” Ronnie asked, suddenly fretful that the sisters had broken in.

“Two copies.” Lincoln held up the two books. “Clyde must’ve forgotten his. Oh well. I can return it to him tomorrow. But hey, at least this means we each get our own book,” he said while handing a copy to Ronnie, which she tentatively took.

“Yeah, great. Um, I might have just imagined it, but it sounded like your sister Luan said something about you reading comics in your,” she swallowed, “undies.”

“Yeah, I do,” Lincoln answered plainly. “I like being comfy while I read and clothes are just so constricting.” Then Lincoln thought about his words and how they might be taken by an outsider. “I don’t have to if it bothers you, though. I’ve already read this one, so I can just wait for you.”

“N-no, no. that’s fine. I mean, this is your house. It wouldn’t be right for me to impose,” Ronnie said politely. On the inside, however, she was screaming at herself. Where were these words coming from and why was her mouth so insistent on spitting them out? “Besides, I’d feel awkward if you were just watching me read.” Which was honest enough.

“Okay, cool. I try to be mindful of the fact that not everyone’s used to this kind of environment,” Lincoln explained as he pulled his shirt off.

This revealed to Ronnie that he wasn’t quite as scrawny as she’d believed. There was some actual muscle definition there, if only a little. He continued stripping, turning around and letting his jeans drop. Ronnie’s eyes were starting to hurt from going so long without blinking. It almost felt like her peepers might pop right out of her skull when he turned around in his near naked glory, looking perfectly content with himself.

This was either the best idea Ronnie Anne ever had, or the worst…

What flavor of awkward will you choose next?

The pair read comics ‘peacefully’.
Nosy sisters are nosy.
Rita has some words.
Clyde calls Lincoln.
13112113212111111111111111111111111.title: Into the Lionesses' Den

1311211321212.content:
While Lincoln read, Lola had called a secret sibling meeting. Upon seeing how serious she was, everyone dropped what they were doing and gathered in Lori and Leni’s room. They took up their usual sitting arrangements, with the exception of Leni still being inside of Luna.

“So what’s the deal-e-o, li’l sis?” asked the rocker. “And where’s Lincoln? Shouldn’t he be here, too?”

Lola took up the presenter position on the wall opposite the beds. “Lincoln is the subject of this meeting.”

Muffled sounds came from Luna’s gut, with the rocker electing to translate. “Leni wants to go on record that she’s not comfortable with talking about Link behind his back. I’d like to second that motion.”

Luan raised her hand. “Third.”

“What’s this even about, Lola?” questioned Lori before things got out of hand and everyone walked out.

“Well, I was just thinking that maybe… possibly…. We miiight be a little too hard on Lincoln.” At Lola’s words, she was immediately met with an uproar of accusations and denials from the others.

With a roll of her eyes, Lori joined the pink sister in the presenting spot, picked up her gavel, and tapped it to her desk. “Order. Order in the… room. Let Lola say her piece.”

“Thanks, Lori.”

“We’ll decide if she needs to be shoved up Lana’s butt after the fact.” Lori turned a warning look on the smaller blonde, giving her the chance to reconsider her position. Lola, to the surprise of none, stubbornly refused to back down. “Very well. You may speak.”

“Thanks, I guess.” Lola cleared her throat and addressed her audience. “First of all, I’m not trying to suggest anything crazy like we should stop eating him. I think we can all agree that he’s our favorite boy to swallow.” That got a round of affirmatives from the sisters. “But he’s more than just a yummy treat. He’s our brother.” She indicated her dress. “He just finished repairing my dress for me and all he wanted in return was a safe escort back to his room. And that’s just the latest example. I saw all of you,” she pointed between the three eldest sisters, “and mom asking him for stuff earlier. You’d basically cornered him with no way out except into someone’s gut. Does that seem fair to you?”

“Well, he’s prey, dudette. Going inside a predator is kinda his thing,” Luna argued, not sounding like she fully believed her own words. “Ugh, speak up Leni. I don’t want to be your translator.”

“I was just saying that all I wanted was a tummy rub, and maybe a little naked snuggling.”

“Uh huh,” Lola said skeptically. “Meaning you were gonna crush him under that giant gut of yours.” Leni had no reply as Lola looked up to Luna. “And you. Do you really have to say that you don’t view Lincoln as a real man?”

“Aw, c’mon, dudette. He knows I’m just foolin’ around.”

“That is a little on the mean side,” added Luan.

“Weak, fam,” Luna griped. “I was gonna shove the little dude up my pussy.” She patted her swollen gut. “He’d been looking down lately, so I thought I’d do him a favor.”

“By backing him into a corner?” deadpanned Lola.

Luna opened her mouth to argue her point, but nothing came out.

“And you.”

Lori threw up her hands defensively. “Hey, whoa now. Before we get ahead of ourselves, I had a phone rattling around in my stomach. You all know how annoying that is. I really thought it was his, so it made sense for him to get it. Besides, he said it was nice of me to not digest what I thought was his.” She folded her arms in vindication. “So there.”

“The point is that we all push Lincoln around too much. He’s more than just our prey and we need to show him how much we like him for more than his taste.”

“What are you proposing?” Lori asked, intrigued.

“I’ve got a couple ideas, but I’d like to put it out to the floor. Let’s think of something we can do for Lincoln to show how much he means to us… that doesn’t involve vore.” That last part got a round of whines and complaints, but ultimately they agreed. Now they just had to think of something.
1311211321212.title: Are We Too Pushy With Lincoln?

13131.content: Were they born shrunk, or was this some freak accidently most likely caused by Lisa?
13131.title: Shrunken Louds

131311.content: Shall we start with Lincoln? One tiny boy with 10 sisters seems interesting.
131311.title: Loud Born Shrunk

1313111.content:
“Hello everyone. Lincoln Loud here,” he said, beginning the morning by breaking the fourth wall. “You’re probably wondering why my room looks so different. Well, that’s because it is. It’s actually my sister Lori’s old doll house. See, I was born a minizora. That means that at a mere three inches tall, I don’t have much chance of getting any bigger, but that’s life. And really, my life is pretty great, all things considered.

“I’ve got loving parents, ten awesome sisters, and pets that actually don’t want to chew on me. Then there are my clothes, a private TV, game station, comics, and pretty much all the essentials of life at a miniature size. I even have a private bathroom, though it’s more like a tiny porta-potty that needs to be emptied once a week. Really, I’m pretty lucky. Granted, being so small, I’m pretty dependent on my sisters for a lot of stuff. I’m basically not allowed to go anywhere outside the house unless one of them is carrying me. Worse, because I’m so small and cute, most of the time they insist on carrying me inside their clothes. That can get pretty nasty when one of them has a gas attack. Bleh. But usually it’s fine.

“My mom and sisters have really soft, warm bodies, so except for a bad gas attack, I don’t mind being carried around in someone’s bra or even panties. And being a minizora, I’m durable enough that I can take pretty much whatever life throws at me, even my family using me as a communal sex toy. Again, not usually a problem. My family does so much for me and it’s nice that I can give something back. It’s like my household chore. Certainly beats taking out the trash, I can tell you that.”

There came a knock at the dollhouse door.

“And it looks like my day is about to get started.” Lincoln casually headed over to the red plastic door, ready to greet the world with a smile on his face, but who was there to greet him?
1313111.title: Lincoln Born Tiny

13131111.content:
“Good morning, baby bro,” greeted the eldest Loud sister as she opened the wall of the doll house. Lori was blonde, like their mother, and took after her in a lot of other ways. Blessed by Rita’s genes, she had the same curves, full chest, and hips that just wouldn’t stop as the woman who birthed her. Her smile was kind, but also a little condescending as she looked into her younger brother’s little apartment.

“Hey Lori,” Lincoln replied casually, waving as he sat on the edge of his bed. “What’s up?”

“Its breakfast time, dork. And it’s my turn for Lincoln duty today, so you know what that means,” she said with a mischievous grin.

Lincoln scratched his chin, rubbed the back of his neck, and went through several other thoughtful poses as he paced, pretending to wonder. “Let me see here. Hmm. Does it mean… I’m going in your underwear?”

Lori tittered, reached into the doll house, and scooped up her littlest sibling. “How’d you guess?” She didn’t give him time to answer before depositing him into her cleavage. It was the most convenient position for all involved, keeping the carrier’s hands free while affording Lincoln a decent view. Not to mention he felt really good wiggling against a pair of sensitive breasts.

Lori’s bosoms were soft and just a little bit squishy, making them ideal for reclining. Lincoln did just that, or at least as best he could while his lower half was wedged within boob flesh. He gave a contented sigh and spread his hands out, feeling the way his sister’s skin bristled with goose bumps. It was a nice feeling. “Oh, you know. Just a feeling,” he replied blissfully.

“Heeey!” whined Leni. Second oldest, her figure was almost as curvy as Lori’s, though she had more of a ditzy charm that tended to draw in more boys. “How come you get Lincoln today? I thought it was supposed to be my turn.”

“It was, before we made that bet, remember?” Lori reminded smugly. “You lost, which means that your day now belongs to me.”

Lincoln was broken from his relaxation by the sight of his sad sister. Leni in particular was such an innocent soul that it actually hurt to see her upset. “That’s not fair, Lori.”

“Oh, what do you care? My boobs are bigger than hers, anyway.”

Lincoln had to struggle to twist around and face the tyrannical sister. “It’s not about boobs. It’s about being a good brother. Today was Leni’s turn and you shouldn’t have made that bet in the first place. Besides, just because it’s your turn, that doesn’t mean you’ve got me exclusively. Clyde’s coming over today, remember.”

“I do, but I don’t see the problem,” Lori dismissed. “I’m sure he’d be just fine doing whatever it is you guys do while staring at my chest all day.”

Lincoln grimaced. “Okay, probably; but my point still stands. Besides, it’s not like you asked me about this dumb bet. I might be a minizora, but that doesn’t mean you get to treat me as an object to be passed around.”

Lori scoffed down at the boy in her cleavage. “Lincoln, that’s literally what being a minizora is all about. You can’t look after yourself, so it’s up to your family to keep you safe. And, as a part of this family, that means you’ve got to pull your weight around here, bucko.”

Lincoln rolled his eyes. “Yeah, I know, which is what I’m arguing for. Today is supposed to be Leni’s turn. She’s been waiting over a week for this; and honestly, so have I. How can you just take away our day together?”

“We were going to go shopping,” Leni sniffled.

“Seriously, Leni. You’re too nice for your own good sometimes. Time with Lincoln is like time in the bathroom. You want it; you’ve got to seize it when the other’s aren’t looking.”

Lincoln heaved a heavy sigh. Lori wasn’t wrong. He loved his sisters and liked spending time with them. The turns system was supposed to keep things fair. But alas, too often his sisters would get impatient. One minute he might be critiquing Lucy on her latest poem, and then she’d turn her back and he’d find himself in the audience of Luan’s latest joke routine. And then there were all the things that happened outside the turns. Even if it was Lola’s turn, Lyn would still get to borrow him by shoving him in her jockstrap and going through an elaborate exercise routine as part of her superstitious sports rituals. Then there were the deals. Sometimes it was a bet, but others it was like when Luna offered to do Lana’s chores for a week if she got to bring Lincoln along for her date with Sam. That… had been a nice night. Admittedly, the system was pretty broken, but it was still preferable to total anarchy.

Fortunately for Lincoln, it was actually Leni who delivered the winning argument. Not with eloquent words, as those had never been the blonde airhead’s strong suit, but with action. Specifically, she started whimpering like a kicked puppy. Lincoln had to shield his eyes, for no one with a soul could withstand Leni’s unparalleled pitifulness. Lori, however, wasn’t so quick.

“Ugh, fine,” groused the eldest. “I still won, so I’m keeping Lincoln until lunch. You can have him after that. Sound fair?”

Leni perked up immediately and rushed over, wrapping Lori in a constrictive embrace. “Thank-you-thank-you-thank-you! You’re the best!” As she gushed, she also unknowingly smothered her chest against Lincoln, compressing him between a boob and a soft place. Fortunately, he was used to this kind of treatment. The only surprising thing was that when Lori finally pushed Leni away, Lincoln was still wedged in Lori’s cleavage.

“Yeah, yeah. I know I’m great,” Lori replied, nonchalantly checking her nails as her free hand adjusted her bra. Though it was really an excuse to coax Lincoln into wiggling more. As every Loud sister knew, his little body was a boundless source of stimulation. “Okay, Stinken,” she said down to her boobs. “Ready to get this Saturday started?”

131411.content:
“Hello everyone. Lincoln Loud here,” he said, beginning the morning by breaking the fourth wall. “You’re probably wondering why my room looks so different. Well, that’s because it is. It’s actually my sister Lori’s old doll house. See, I was born a minizora. That means that at a mere three inches tall, I don’t have much chance of getting any bigger, but that’s life. And really, my life is pretty great, all things considered.

“I’ve got loving parents, ten awesome sisters, and pets that actually don’t want to chew on me. Then there are my clothes, a private TV, game station, comics, and pretty much all the essentials of life at a miniature size. I even have a private bathroom, though it’s more like a tiny porta-potty that needs to be emptied once a week. Really, I’m pretty lucky. Granted, being so small, I’m pretty dependent on my sisters for a lot of stuff. I’m basically not allowed to go anywhere outside the house unless one of them is carrying me. Worse, because I’m so small and cute, most of the time they insist on carrying me inside their clothes. That can get pretty nasty when one of them has a gas attack. Bleh. But usually it’s fine.

“My mom and sisters have really soft, warm bodies, so except for a bad gas attack, I don’t mind being carried around in someone’s bra or even panties. And being a minizora, I’m durable enough that I can take pretty much whatever life throws at me, even my family using me as a communal sex toy. Again, not usually a problem. My family does so much for me and it’s nice that I can give something back. It’s like my household chore. Certainly beats taking out the trash, I can tell you that.”

There came a knock at the dollhouse door.

“And it looks like my day is about to get started.” Lincoln casually headed over to the red plastic door, ready to greet the world with a smile on his face, but who was there to greet him?

1331.title: Vore

13311.content:
It was a day like any other for Timmy Turner. His parents had left him in the hands of his sadistic babysitter to do god-knows-what. The boy’s only solace were his fairies, Cosmo and Wanda, who could grant him just about any wish he could think of. There were rules, of course. No killing, no messing with true love, no cheating in official competitions, yada-yada. However, in ruminating over Da Rulez, Timmy had a small epiphany.

“Hey Wanda. I’ve got a question,” he called.

A goldfish with pink eyes swam out from the little castle in the fish bowl. “What’s up, sport?”

“I was just thinking about Da Rulez. Specifically the part that says I can’t wish anyone in or out of love.”

“That’s true, sport. Even fairies can’t go messing with stuff that powerful.”

“Right, and I get that, but what about lust?”

“… Say what?”

“Lust. Like, I can’t wish someone would fall in love with me, but can I wish that they fell in lust with me? You know,” his eyes shifted guiltily, “just curious.”

Frowning, Wanda pulled out a copy of Da Rulez and began flipping through the pages. Her expression paled as she read the book backwards and forwards. In time she noticed Timmy giving her an expectant look and figured that there was no point delaying the inevitable. “Uh… no. There are no rules on anything related to sex.”

Timmy rubbed his hands together. “Sweet. In that case, for my first wish…”
